required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predicting Acute Kidney Injury After Coronary Artery Bypass Graft
clinical_study.official_title: Predicting Acute Kidney Injury After Coronary Artery Bypass Graft : a Simplified Clinical Risk Scoring Model

brief_summary.textblock: Acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery is a major complication after cardiac surgery and has been reported to be associated with adverse outcome. There have been many studies reporting risk factor of acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery, but the influence of perioperative variables related to anesthesia and perioperative medication has not been evaluated fully. The investigators attempt to evaluate the influence of preoperative medication, preoperative albumin level, uric acid concentration, anesthesia technique, use of hydroxy ethyl starch, blood glucose level, intraoperative medication, and hemodynamic variables during surgery on the incidence of acute kidney injury after coronary artery bypass graft.

detailed_description.textblock: Acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery is a major complication after cardiac surgery and has been reported to be associated with adverse outcome. There have been many studies reporting risk factor of acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery, but the influence of perioperative variables related to anesthesia and perioperative medication has not been evaluated fully. The investigators attempt to evaluate the influence of preoperative medication, preoperative albumin level, uric acid concentration, anesthesia technique, use of hydroxy ethyl starch, blood glucose level, intraoperative medication, and hemodynamic variables during surgery on the incidence of acute kidney injury after coronary artery bypass graft.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.measure: Acute kidney injury diagnosis defined by RIFLE criteria
primary_outcome.description: Acute kidney injury diagnosis defined by RIFLE criteria (for Risk, Injury, Failure, Loss, End-stage kidney disease) during seven days after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute kidney injury as defined by AKIN (acute kidney injury network) criteria
secondary_outcome.description: Acute kidney injury as defined by AKIN (acute kidney injury network) criteria

arm_group.description: patients who underwent coronary artery bypass surgery between 2010 and 2012 in Samsung Medical Center

study_pop.textblock: patients who underwent coronary artery bypass surgery during between 2010 and 2012 in Samsung Medical Center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who underwent coronary artery bypass surgery during between 2010 and 2012 in Samsung Medical Center
Exclusion Criteria:
- lack of postoperative creatinine or urine output data
- patients who expired within 24hours after surgery
